Zann ChuaLevel 6. MasterUpdated on 07 Jun 2019Hello!
Instead of asking how much to save before investing, maybe you can look at it from another perspective in terms of ensuring that your high-interest debts are paid off before investing. The recommended amount of savings would be about 6-9 months of your emergency funds in order to ensure that you will have enough savings should anything happen to your job.It is important to pay off all your high interest debt first so that you would not inccur too much interest. I personally feel that once you have done these few things it would be the best time to start investing. You should try to do this as soon as possible as investing early as possible would be the ideal situation due to compounding.2 comments3
